ygData.subject: Re: Petition or Melee vs. Caster damage
ygData.msgSnippet: Mages have a limit at what they can do though.  Sure they can hit with a spell for 1200 damage, but they have mana that will eventually run out.  By what you
ygData.messageBody:
Mages have a limit at what they can do though. Sure they can hit with a
spell for 1200 damage, but they have mana that will eventually run out. By
what you are suggesting, a warrior could keep swinging and swinging for
1200 damage per attack without losing that ability after prolonged use (did
that make sense)? The critical strike is probably a good solution, as well
as the specialization skill - but in no way should a warrior be able to do
as much damage as a caster.

> I think the difference between melee combatants and casters magic should
> be
> thus: Melee fighters should be able to do just as much damage, if not
> more,
> whereas a caster may strike from a distance, and strike multiple targets
> with area effect spells.
>
> I am the president of a national group that fights with live steel
> weapons.
> I've been fighting with long swords, 2-handed swords, axes and maces for
> 10
> years, and I am very comfortable with just how devastating these weapons
> can
> be. No matter if you are struck by lightning or are cut in 2 by a large
> axe, you are just as dead!
>
> So perhaps the direction we need to seek, and the difference between these
> 2
> types of characters. melee and caster, is not how much damage they do, but
> how. A caster should be able to reach far away, and strike multiple
> targets, while the great warrior should only be able to strike at one
> target
> at a time, but be able to mow them down like wheat.
>
